csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Coppock Curve
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// A momentum indicator designed to identify major market bottoms in the long term (monthly) charts.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Formula: WMA[10] of (ROC[Short] + ROC[Long])</description></item>
13 /// </list>
14 /// </remarks>
15 public class CoppockCurve
16 {
17 public int ShortROC { get; }
18 public int LongROC { get; }
19 public int WMAPeriod { get; }
20 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
21​
22 public CoppockCurve(int shortRoc = 11, int longRoc = 14, int wmaPeriod = 10)
23 {
24 ShortROC = shortRoc;
25 LongROC = longRoc;
26 WMAPeriod = wmaPeriod;
27 }
28​
29 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
30 {
31 Values.Clear();
32 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
33 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
34​
35 // Step 1: Calculate Sum of ROCs
36 var rocSum = new List<decimal?>();
37​
38 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
39 {
40 // Note: Need the longest lookback
41 if (i < LongROC)
42 {
43 rocSum.Add(null);
44 continue;
45 }
46​
47 // Short ROC
48 decimal shortRocVal = candleList[i - ShortROC].Close != 0
49 ? ((candleList[i].Close - candleList[i - ShortROC].Close) / candleList[i - ShortROC].Close) * 100
50 : 0;
51​
52 // Long ROC
53 decimal longRocVal = candleList[i - LongROC].Close != 0
54 ? ((candleList[i].Close - candleList[i - LongROC].Close) / candleList[i - LongROC].Close) * 100
55 : 0;
56​
57 rocSum.Add(shortRocVal + longRocVal);
58 }
59​
60 // Step 2: Weighted Moving Average (WMA) of the ROC Sum
61 decimal weightSum = WMAPeriod * (WMAPeriod + 1) / 2m;
62 int validCount = 0;
63​
64 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
65 {
66 if (!rocSum[i].HasValue)
67 {
68 Values.Add(null);
69 continue;
70 }
71​
72 validCount++;
73​
74 if (validCount < WMAPeriod)
75 {
76 Values.Add(null);
77 continue;
78 }
79​
80 decimal sum = 0;
81 int weight = WMAPeriod;
82 int count = 0;
83
84 // Working backwards for WMA
85 for (int j = i; j >= 0 && count < WMAPeriod; j--)
86 {
87 if (rocSum[j].HasValue)
88 {
89 sum += rocSum[j]!.Value * weight;
90 weight--;
91 count++;
92 }
93 }
94​
95 Values.Add(sum / weightSum);
96 }
97 }
98​
99 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int shortRoc = 11, int longRoc = 14, int wmaPeriod = 10)
100 {
101 var cc = new CoppockCurve(shortRoc, longRoc, wmaPeriod);
102 cc.Calculate(candles);
103 return cc.Values;
104 }
105 }
106}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (CoppockCurve)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Coppock Curve technical indicator.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. Rate of Change (ROC) Summation
13// [Why] To capture market momentum over different timeframes.
14// [What] The sum of a "Long" ROC (e.g., 14 months) and a "Short" ROC (e.g., 11 months).
15// [How] ROC = ((CurrentClose - OldClose) / OldClose) * 100
16// RawVal = ROC_Short + ROC_Long
17//
18// 2. Weighted Moving Average (WMA)
19// [Why] The raw summation is very volatile; smoothing reveals the true trend.
20// [What] A standard WMA applied to the raw summation values.
21// [How] Gives more weight to recent data points.
22// Weight factor decreases linearly (10, 9, 8, ..., 1).
23//
24// [History]
25// Created by E.S. Coppock in 1962. Originally designed for monthly charts to
26// identify long-term buying opportunities in the S&P 500.
27// It was allegedly inspired by Episcopal Church inquiries asking "How long
28// do people mourn?" (hence the 11-14 month periods).
29//
30// [Visual Plan]
31// Data Flow:
32// [Prices] -> [ROC14 + ROC11] -> [Raw Series] -> [WMA10] -> [Coppock Curve]
33//
34// =============================================================================
35​
36using System;
37using System.Collections.Generic;
38using System.Linq;
39​
40namespace TechnicalIndicators
41{
42 // =============================================================================
43 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
44 // =============================================================================
45 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
46​
47 // =============================================================================
48 // Logic Explanation: Coppock Curve Class
49 //
50 // [Why] A long-term momentum oscillator used primarily to detect major bottoms.
51 //
52 // [What] Outputs a single list of decimal values.
53 // Crosses from negative to positive are often seen as buy signals.
54 // =============================================================================
55 public class CoppockCurve
56 {
57 // -------------------------------------------------------------
58 // Logic Explanation: Configuration
59 //
60 // [ShortROC] Lookback for the faster ROC (default 11).
61 // [LongROC] Lookback for the slower ROC (default 14).
62 // [WMAPeriod] Smoothing window (default 10).
63 // -------------------------------------------------------------
64 public int ShortROC { get; }
65 public int LongROC { get; }
66 public int WMAPeriod { get; }
67 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
68​
69 // =============================================================================
70 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
71 // =============================================================================
72 public CoppockCurve(int shortRoc = 11, int longRoc = 14, int wmaPeriod = 10)
73 {
74 ShortROC = shortRoc;
75 LongROC = longRoc;
76 WMAPeriod = wmaPeriod;
77 }
78​
79 // =============================================================================
80 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
81 //
82 // [Why] Two-stage calculation process:
83 // 1. Calculate the raw ROC sum series.
84 // 2. Smooth that series using WMA.
85 // =============================================================================
86 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
87 {
88 // -------------------------------------------------------------
89 // Step 1: Initialization
90 // -------------------------------------------------------------
91 Values.Clear();
92 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
93 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
94​
95 // -------------------------------------------------------------
96 // Step 2: Calculate Raw ROC Sum Series
97 //
98 // [Why] (Intent)
99 // Create the intermediate dataset that will be smoothed later.
100 //
101 // [Visual]
102 // Time: t-14 ... t-11 ... t
103 // LongROC: [Diff.......]
104 // ShortROC: [Diff..]
105 // Result: Sum these two
106 // -------------------------------------------------------------
107 var rocSum = new List<decimal?>();
108​
109 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
110 {
111 // -------------------------------------------------------------
112 // Step 2a: Check Data Sufficiency
113 //
114 // [Decision]
115 // Do we have enough history for the Long ROC?
116 // Example: If LongROC is 14, we need index i >= 14
117 // (comparing index 14 vs index 0).
118 //
119 // Wait, standard ROC is (Close[i] - Close[i-N])/Close[i-N].
120 // So at i=N, we compare with i-N=0. This is valid.
121 // So i < LongROC is correct condition to skip.
122 // -------------------------------------------------------------
123 if (i < LongROC)
124 {
125 rocSum.Add(null);
126 continue;
127 }
128​
129 // -------------------------------------------------------------
130 // Step 2b: Calculate ROCs
131 //
132 // [Formula]
133 // ROC = (Current - Prior) / Prior * 100
134 //
135 // [Safety]
136 // Check for division by zero (Prior Close = 0).
137 // -------------------------------------------------------------
138
139 // Short ROC
140 decimal closePriorShort = candleList[i - ShortROC].Close;
141 decimal shortRocVal = 0;
142 if (closePriorShort != 0)
143 {
144 shortRocVal = ((candleList[i].Close - closePriorShort) / closePriorShort) * 100;
145 }
146​
147 // Long ROC
148 decimal closePriorLong = candleList[i - LongROC].Close;
149 decimal longRocVal = 0;
150 if (closePriorLong != 0)
151 {
152 longRocVal = ((candleList[i].Close - closePriorLong) / closePriorLong) * 100;
153 }
154​
155 // -------------------------------------------------------------
156 // Step 2c: Store Sum
157 // -------------------------------------------------------------
158 rocSum.Add(shortRocVal + longRocVal);
159 }
160​
161 // -------------------------------------------------------------
162 // Step 3: Weighted Moving Average (WMA) Smoothing
163 //
164 // [Why] (Intent)
165 // Smooth the 'rocSum' list to produce the final curve.
166 //
167 // [Math]
168 // WMA = Sum(Price * Weight) / Sum(Weights)
169 // Weights for Period 10: 10, 9, 8, ..., 1
170 // Most recent price gets weight 10.
171 // -------------------------------------------------------------
172
173 // Pre-calculate sum of weights for Period N: N*(N+1)/2
174 decimal weightSum = WMAPeriod * (WMAPeriod + 1) / 2m;
175
176 // Track how many valid non-null rocSum items we have encountered.
177 // We can't start WMA until we have 'WMAPeriod' valid numbers.
178 int validCount = 0;
179​
180 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
181 {
182 // If current rocSum is null, result is null
183 if (rocSum[i] == null)
184 {
185 Values.Add(null);
186 continue;
187 }
188​
189 // We have a valid number!
190 validCount++;
191​
192 // Do we have enough history of valid numbers?
193 // Example: We need 10 valid sums to calculate one WMA(10).
194 if (validCount < WMAPeriod)
195 {
196 Values.Add(null);
197 continue;
198 }
199​
200 // -------------------------------------------------------------
201 // Step 3a: Perform WMA Calculation
202 //
203 // [Visual]
204 // Window (Period=3):
205 // Values: [10, 20, 30]
206 // Weights: 1 2 3 (Most recent '30' gets weight 3)
207 //
208 // Calculation:
209 // (30*3 + 20*2 + 10*1) / (1+2+3)
210 //
211 // [Loop Logic]
212 // Start from j=i (current), walk back 'WMAPeriod' steps.
213 // Weight starts at WMAPeriod, decrements each step back.
214 // -------------------------------------------------------------
215 decimal sum = 0;
216 int weight = WMAPeriod;
217 int collected = 0;
218​
219 // Walk backwards from current index 'i'
220 // We are guaranteed to find 'WMAPeriod' valid values because validCount >= WMAPeriod
221 for (int j = i; j >= 0 && collected < WMAPeriod; j--)
222 {
223 // Skip any nulls (though logically they should be at the start)
224 if (rocSum[j].HasValue)
225 {
226 sum += rocSum[j]!.Value * weight;
227 weight--;
228 collected++;
229 }
230 }
231​
232 Values.Add(sum / weightSum);
233 }
234 }
235​
236 // =============================================================================
237 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
238 // =============================================================================
239 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int shortRoc = 11, int longRoc = 14, int wmaPeriod = 10)
240 {
241 var cc = new CoppockCurve(shortRoc, longRoc, wmaPeriod);
242 cc.Calculate(candles);
243 return cc.Values;
244 }
245 }
246}
python_simple:
1class CoppockCurve:
2 """
3 Coppock Curve
4 WMA_10( ROC_14 + ROC_11 )
5 """
6 def __init__(self, short_roc=11, long_roc=14, wma_period=10):
7 self.short_roc = short_roc
8 self.long_roc = long_roc
9 self.wma_period = wma_period
10 self.values = []
11​
12 def calculate(self, candles):
13 self.values.clear()
14 if len(candles) == 0: return
15​
16 # 1. Sum ROCs
17 roc_sum = []
18 for i in range(len(candles)):
19 if i < self.long_roc:
20 roc_sum.append(None)
21 continue
22
23 # Short ROC
24 curr = candles[i]['close']
25 prev_s = candles[i - self.short_roc]['close']
26 roc_s = ((curr - prev_s) / prev_s * 100) if prev_s != 0 else 0
27
28 # Long ROC
29 prev_l = candles[i - self.long_roc]['close']
30 roc_l = ((curr - prev_l) / prev_l * 100) if prev_l != 0 else 0
31
32 roc_sum.append(roc_s + roc_l)
33
34 # 2. WMA
35 # Need to handle None values in roc_sum
36 wma_denom = self.wma_period * (self.wma_period + 1) / 2
37
38 for i in range(len(candles)):
39 if roc_sum[i] is None:
40 self.values.append(None)
41 continue
42
43 # Check if we have enough history for WMA (need N valid values)
44 # Logic check: roc_sum has None until long_roc.
45 # So actual valid index starts at long_roc.
46 # We need wma_period valid points starting from there.
47 if i < self.long_roc + self.wma_period - 1:
48 self.values.append(None)
49 continue
50
51 numerator = 0.0
52 weight = self.wma_period
53
54 for j in range(self.wma_period):
55 # i - j
56 val = roc_sum[i - j]
57 numerator += val * weight
58 weight -= 1
59
60 self.values.append(numerator / wma_denom)
61​
62def calculate(candles, short_roc=11, long_roc=14, wma_period=10):
63 cc = CoppockCurve(short_roc, long_roc, wma_period)
64 cc.calculate(candles)
65 return cc.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (CoppockCurve)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Coppock Curve. We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data
7# transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Long-Term Momentum
11# Originally designed for monthly charts to identify long-term buying opportunities
12# in the stock market (S&P 500).
13#
14# 2. Sum of ROCs
15# Combines two Rate of Change (ROC) periods: a long one (e.g., 14) and
16# a slightly shorter one (e.g., 11).
17# Concept: Aggregates momentum from two different timeframes.
18#
19# 3. WMA Smoothing
20# The sum of ROCs is then smoothed by a Weighted Moving Average (WMA).
21# WMA gives more weight to recent data, reducing lag compared to SMA.
22#
23# [Formula]
24# Coppock = WMA(ROC(Long) + ROC(Short), WMA_Period)
25#
26# =============================================================================
27​
28​
29# -------------------------------------------------------------
30# Type-Level Explanation: CoppockCurve (class)
31#
32# [Why] Encapsulates 3 parameters and multi-stage calculation.
33# [What] Momentum indicator for long-term trends.
34# [Who] Trend followers, long-term investors.
35# [Where] Heap allocation.
36# -------------------------------------------------------------
37class CoppockCurve:
38​
39 # -------------------------------------------------------------
40 # Constructor: __init__
41 #
42 # [Why] Configure the 3 key components.
43 # [What] short_roc (11), long_roc (14), wma_period (10).
44 # -------------------------------------------------------------
45 def __init__(self, short_roc=11, long_roc=14, wma_period=10):
46
47 # -------------------------------------------------------------
48 # Logic Step 1: Validation
49 #
50 # [Decision]
51 # Are parameters valid (> 0)?
52 # -------------------------------------------------------------
53 if short_roc <= 0 or long_roc <= 0 or wma_period <= 0:
54 raise ValueError("All periods must be positive")
55​
56 self.short_roc = short_roc
57 self.long_roc = long_roc
58 self.wma_period = wma_period
59 self.values = []
60​
61​
62 # =============================================================================
63 # IPO: calculate
64 # =============================================================================
65 #
66 # [Input]
67 # - candles: list[dict]
68 #
69 # [Process]
70 # 1. Calculate raw ROC sum vector: (ROC_short + ROC_long) for each bar.
71 # 2. Apply WMA smoothing to the ROC sum vector.
72 #
73 # [Output]
74 # - None (populates self.values).
75 # =============================================================================
76 def calculate(self, candles):
77
78 # -------------------------------------------------------------
79 # Logic Step 1: Reset & Guard
80 # -------------------------------------------------------------
81 self.values.clear()
82 if len(candles) == 0:
83 return
84​
85 # -------------------------------------------------------------
86 # Logic Step 2: Calculate ROC Sums (Intermediate Series)
87 #
88 # [Why] (Intent)
89 # Prepare the raw data that will be fed into the WMA.
90 #
91 # [Formula]
92 # ROC = (Current - Prev) / Prev * 100
93 # Value = ROC(Short) + ROC(Long)
94 # -------------------------------------------------------------
95 roc_sum = []
96
97 for i in range(len(candles)):
98
99 # -------------------------------------------------------------
100 # Logic Step 2.1: Insufficient History for Long ROC
101 #
102 # [Condition]
103 # Current index must support the longest lookback.
104 # -------------------------------------------------------------
105 if i < self.long_roc:
106 roc_sum.append(None)
107 continue
108​
109 # -------------------------------------------------------------
110 # Logic Step 2.2: Compute ROCs
111 #
112 # [How] (Logic)
113 # Calculate percentage change. Handle Div/0.
114 # -------------------------------------------------------------
115
116 # Short ROC
117 prev_short = candles[i - self.short_roc]['close']
118 if prev_short != 0:
119 short_val = ((candles[i]['close'] - prev_short) / prev_short) * 100
120 else:
121 short_val = 0
122
123 # Long ROC
124 prev_long = candles[i - self.long_roc]['close']
125 if prev_long != 0:
126 long_val = ((candles[i]['close'] - prev_long) / prev_long) * 100
127 else:
128 long_val = 0
129​
130 # Store sum
131 roc_sum.append(short_val + long_val)
132​
133​
134 # -------------------------------------------------------------
135 # Logic Step 3: WMA Calculation on ROC Sums
136 #
137 # [Core Concept] Weighted Moving Average
138 # [Formula] Sum(Value * Weight) / Sum(Weights)
139 # Weights: 1, 2, 3, ... N (Linearly increasing)
140 # -------------------------------------------------------------
141
142 # Pre-calculate Sum of Weights (Arithmetic Series sum)
143 # 1+2+...+N = N*(N+1)/2
144 weight_sum_denominator = self.wma_period * (self.wma_period + 1) / 2
145
146 # Count consecutive valid ROC values
147 valid_roc_count = 0
148​
149 for i in range(len(candles)):
150
151 # -------------------------------------------------------------
152 # Logic Step 3.1: Check Source Validity
153 #
154 # [Why] (Intent)
155 # If the underlying ROC sum matches (from Step 2) is None, output is None.
156 # roc_sum is aligned with candles but starts with Nones.
157 #
158 # Note: roc_sum index 'i' actually corresponds to candles index 'i'
159 # (since we appended Nones). However, let's correspond carefully.
160 # -------------------------------------------------------------
161 if i >= len(roc_sum) or roc_sum[i] is None:
162 # This check handles the initial Nones in roc_sum
163 self.values.append(None)
164 continue
165
166 valid_roc_count += 1
167
168 # -------------------------------------------------------------
169 # Logic Step 3.2: Wait for WMA window
170 #
171 # [Condition]
172 # Need 'wma_period' valid ROC points.
173 # -------------------------------------------------------------
174 if valid_roc_count < self.wma_period:
175 self.values.append(None)
176 continue
177​
178 # -------------------------------------------------------------
179 # Logic Step 3.3: Compute WMA
180 #
181 # [Visual] Period 3
182 # ROCs: [10, 20, 30] (Most recent is 30)
183 # Weights: 1, 2, 3
184 # Calc: (10*1 + 20*2 + 30*3) / (1+2+3)
185 # (10 + 40 + 90) / 6 = 140/6 = 23.33
186 # -------------------------------------------------------------
187 weighted_total = 0
188 current_weight = self.wma_period
189 points_processed = 0
190
191 # Iterate backwards processing weights
192 j = i
193 while j >= 0 and points_processed < self.wma_period:
194 if roc_sum[j] is not None:
195 weighted_total += roc_sum[j] * current_weight
196 current_weight -= 1
197 points_processed += 1
198 j -= 1
199
200 self.values.append(weighted_total / weight_sum_denominator)
201​
202​
203# =============================================================================
204# Static Wrapper Function
205# =============================================================================
206#
207# [Why]
208# Functional interface.
209#
210# [Pattern: 3-Step Static Wrapper]
211# =============================================================================
212def calculate(candles, short_roc=11, long_roc=14, wma_period=10):
213 # 1. Instantiation
214 cc = CoppockCurve(short_roc, long_roc, wma_period)
215
216 # 2. Execution
217 cc.calculate(candles)
218
219 # 3. Extraction
220 return cc.values
